questions.question: What is the relationship between mean arrival rate and mean service rate for the existence of a steady-state solution?

answers.a: Mean arrival rate = Mean service rate
answers.b: Mean arrival rate > Mean service rate
answers.c: Mean arrival rate < Mean service rate
answers.d: Mean service rate is independent of mean arrival rate for the existence of steady state solution

explanations.a: For mean arrival rate equals to mean service rate, traffic intensity equals to 1, which leads infinite number of customers in the system
explanations.b: In this case, system will collapse due to more arrival in comparison to service in a unit time
explanations.c: This leads to steady state solution as arrivals are less than service in a unit time
explanations.d: In this case, system will collapse due to more arrival in comparison to service in a unit time when arrival rate becomes greater than service rate

questions.question: Little's law defines the relationship between which of the following measures?

answers.a: Mean arrival rate and mean service rate
answers.b: Mean arrival rate and traffic intensity
answers.c: Mean sevice rate and traffic intensity
answers.d: Average number of customers in the system and waiting time in the system

explanations.d: According to Little's law average number of a customer in the system is mean arrival rate times waiting time of a customer in the system

questions.question: In a barber shop run by one barber, the queueing model will be best suited is?

answers.c: Single server with markovian arrival model
answers.d: Multi server with markovian arrival model

explanations.c: Since the customers are served by one man and the service of future state depend on the present state irrespective of the past state
